did.abstract: Owners of Highland Cemetery, Ypsilanti, Michigan. Minutes, financial reports, and register of blocks and lots; also collected historical and research materials relating to the proposed restoration of starkweather Chapel at the cemetery and to the effort to have the cemetery placed on the National Register of Historic Places.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The records came from the Association (donor no. 7939).

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Highland Cemetery Association records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Highland Cemetery, located at 943 North River Road in Ypsilanti, Michigan, was dedicated on July 14, 1864. The cemetery was designed by James Lewis Glen of Niles, Michigan. The Starkweather Chapel in the cemetery was designed by George Dewitt Mason and Zachariah Rice of Detroit. The Chapel was the gift of Mary Ann Newberry Starkweather, niece of Chicago entrepreneur and philanthropist, John Newberry. Supporting the work of the Association is its Friends organization. The Friends of Highland Cemetery was founded in 1988, one of whose function was to raise the money needed to restore the Chapel. Another interest of the Friends organization was to work toward the placement of the cemetery on the National Register of Historic Places.

scopecontent.p: The records of Highland Cemetery includes minutes of annual meetings and of the Board of Trustees; newsletters, promotional materials; collected historical and research materials about the cemetery, Starkweather Chapel, and the effort to place the cemetery on the National Register of Historic Places.

did.unittitle: Record book containing register of block, lot, price, and remarks, undated
Minutes of Annual Meetings and of the Board of Trustees, 1863-1963
National Register of Historic Places nomination materials
